page.title: 16Health; the patients.
page.content: At the Brampton Memorial Hospital there is accomodation for one long term elderly patient. Ten beds are used for patients sent in by local practitioners. One bed is always kept available for a patient in need of a holiday or whose family need temporary relief from caring for the invalid. Day care for three patients, to provide a change and relieve the family is available on five days of the week. The hospital is pleasantly situated on the outskirts of the town on Tarn Road. It stands in its own grounds and a hady-man/gardener works there for two days a week. The League of Friends are at present raising money to help towards a planned extension which will eventually provide an extra 9 beds, more physiotherapy facilities and a chiropody section.
